ab.title: Exodus 8
ab.l:
And the Lord said to Moses, ‘Say to Aaron,
“Reach out your hand with your staff over the rivers,
over the Niles, and over the lakes, and
bring up the frogs on the land of Egypt.”’

And Aaron reached out his hand over the waters of Egypt,
and the frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt.

And the magicians did so with their sorcery,
and brought up frogs on the land of Egypt.

And Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron,
and said, ‘Pray to the Lord, that he may take away the frogs
from me and from my people, and I will let the people go,
so that they may do sacrifice to the Lord.’

And Moses said
to Pharaoh, ‘Mark me out when shall I pray
for you and for your servants and for your people,
to cut off the frogs from you and from your houses. They will remain only in the Nile.’

And Pharaoh said, ‘Pray before tomorrow.’
And he said, ‘It will be it according to your word, so that
you may know that there is no one like the Lord our God.

And
the frogs shall depart from you, and from your houses, and from your servants, and
from your people. They will remain only in the Nile.’

And Moses and Aaron went out
from before Pharaoh, and Moses cried to the Lord about the issue
of the frogs which he had brought on Pharaoh.

And
the Lord did according to the word of Moses. And the frogs died
from the houses, from the homesteads, and from the fields.
And they gathered them together in separate heaps, and the land stank.

But Pharaoh saw that there was prosperity, and
he went on hardening his heart, and did not listen to them –
as the Lord had said.

And the Lord said
to Moses, ‘Say to Aaron, “Reach out your staff and
strike the dust of the land, and it shall become lice in all
the land of Egypt.”’

And they did so. And
Aaron reached out his hand with his staff, and smote the dust
of the earth, and it became lice in man, and in animal. All
the dust of the earth became lice in all the land of Egypt.

And the magicians did so with their sorcery,
to bring out the lice, but they were not able. And
the lice was in man, and in animal.

And
the magicians said to Pharaoh, ‘This is the command of God.’ But Pharaoh’s heart was hardened,
and he did not listen to them — as the Lord had said.

And the Lord said to Moses, ‘Rise up early
in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh. Lo, he is going out to the
water. And say to him, “Thus says the Lord, “Let my people go,
so that they may serve me.

Because if you are not letting my people go,
lo, I will send wild beasts on you, and on your servants, and
on your people, and on your houses. And
the houses of the Egyptians will will be filled with wild beasts, and also the ground
on which they are.

And I will set apart in that
day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell,
for no wild beast to be there, so that you may know
that my Providence — me, the Lord — explores the midst
of the land.

And I will put redemption between my people
and your people. This sign will be tomorrow.””’

And the Lord did so. And wild beasts came
intensely to the house of Pharaoh, and to his servants’ houses, and
to all the land of Egypt. The land was broken before the wild
beasts.

And Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron,
and said, ‘Go, do sacrifice to your God in the land.’

And Moses said, ‘It is not proper to do
so, because we will sacrifice to the Lord
our God an abominable thing to Egypt. Lo, if we sacrifice what is abominable
to Egypt before their eyes: will they not stone
us?

We will go three days’ journey in the wilderness, and
we will do sacrifice to the Lord our God, as he tells
us.’

And Pharaoh said, ‘I will let you go,
so that you may do sacrifice to the Lord your God in the wilderness. Only
you shall not go far. Pray for me,
too.’

And Moses said, ‘Lo, I am going out
from before you, and I will pray to the Lord that the wild
beasts may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people at daybreak. Only
let Pharaoh not continue to cheat so as not to let the people go
to do sacrifice to the Lord.’

And Moses went out
from before Pharaoh, and prayed to the Lord.

And the Lord did
according to the word of Moses, and removed the wild
beasts from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people. Not even one remained.

And Pharaoh hardened his heart
this time as well, and he did not let the people go.
